thread.title: Woodbury exhibit ‘Dreaming in Color’ shows works by renowned local artist, Gertrude Barrer
thread.title_full: Woodbury exhibit ‘Dreaming in Color’ shows works by renowned local artist, Gertrude Barrer

title: Woodbury exhibit ‘Dreaming in Color’ shows works by renowned local artist, Gertrude Barrer
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 “Dreaming in Color,” an exhibit of artworks by the late Gertrude Barrer, is on view at Clapp & Tuttle Gallery in Woodbury through Oct. 31. This watercolor and pastel on paper is called “Lady in Auburn.” “Dreaming in Color,” an exhibit of artworks by the late Gertrude Barrer, is on view at Clapp & Tuttle Gallery in Woodbury through Oct. 31. This watercolor and pastel on paper is called “Lady in Auburn.”   Woodbury exhibit ‘Dreaming in Color’ shows works by renowned local artist, Gertrude Barrer 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
“Dreaming in Color,” an exhibit of artworks by the late Gertrude Barrer , is on view at Clapp & Tuttle Gallery in Woodbury, through Oct. 31. 
The show highlights the diversity of Barrer’s world view, and her mastery of color and form. It covers works she created during the start of her career when she was a leading New York City artist, to pieces done when she lived in Roxbury. Barrer collaborated for many years with her husband and fellow artist, Frank Russell. 
Clapp & Tuttle Gallery is at Middle Quarter on Route 6 in Woodbury and can be reached at 203-263-2207. Hours are Tuesdays through Fridays from 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., and Saturdays from 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. 
lkoonz@newstimes.com; Twitter: @LindaTKoonz
